snippet: The remaining staff of the Paris newspaper chose a cartoon with the Prophet Muhammad holding a sign saying, “Je suis Charlie” for its next cover.
abstract: Surviving members of staff of Paris newspaper Charlie Hebdo choose cartoon of Prophet Muhammad for cover of first issue since terrorist attack on their offices, which sparked worldwide debate about freedom of speech, Islamic radicalism and propriety of satirizing religions; staff members have worked on issue even though their offices were closed off, and issue will honor slain colleagues and others killed in attacks.

byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The remaining staff of the Paris newspaper chose a cartoon with the Prophet Muhammad holding a sign saying, “Je suis Charlie” for its next cover.

headline.main: Charlie Hebdo’s New Issue Features Muhammad on Cover
headline.print_headline: Still Mourning, but Printing a New Provocation: Muhammad on the Cover
